title: [QUESTION] [GPU] [Angle] [WPF] Any safe way to FlushAsync() or Flush in other thread?
body:
Canvas.Flush() is taking a lot of time (up to 2 seconds) in my scenarios with huge amount of elements on a canvas, blocking my render thread.
I want to draw next frame, while i'm waiting for previous frame render. Some kind of double buffer render.
Is anyone faced this type issue and found a good solution?

I'm trying to launch Flush() in another thread. It works for a while, works perfectly(huge lag reduce), but unsafe, has random crashes on flush and image draw skia calls.

AFAIK All Flush() is do - is just an endless loop wait for GPU response. So I think I'm doing something wrong and cannot find an obvious solution.
